questions.question_text:
A company needs Amazon EC2 instances for a workload that can tolerate interruptions.

Which EC2 instance purchasing option meets this requirement with the LARGEST discount compared to On-Demand prices?
Which of the following are general AWS Cloud design principles described in the AWS Well-Architected Framework? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Make AWS Cloud architectural decisions static, one-time events.
choices.C: Provision more capacity than a workload is expected to need.
choices.D: Drive architecture design based on data collected about the workload behavior and requirements.
choices.A: Consolidate key components into monolithic architectures.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
Test systems at production scale
Drive architectures using data
https://wa.aws.amazon.com/wat.design_principles.wa-dp.en.html

Selected Answer: BD
B. Test systems at production scale.
D. Drive architecture design based on data collected about the workload behavior and requirements.

"Test systems at production scale: In the cloud, you can create a production-scale test environment on demand, complete your testing, and then decommission the resources. Because you only pay for the test environment when it's running, you can simulate your live environment for a fraction of the cost of testing on premises."

"Drive architectures using data: In the cloud, you can collect data on how your architectural choices affect the behavior of your workload. This lets you make fact-based decisions on how to improve your workload. Your cloud infrastructure is code, so you can use that data to inform your architecture choices and improvements over time."

https://wa.aws.amazon.com/wat.design_principles.wa-dp.en.html

Selected Answer: BD
B and d

Selected Answer: BD
https://wa.aws.amazon.com/wat.design_principles.wa-dp.en.html

ZONCI, STOP USING CHATGPT, USE YOUR BRAIN!

Selected Answer: DE
Drive architecture design based on data collected about the workload behavior and requirements: This principle emphasizes the importance of gathering data and understanding the behavior and requirements of your workload before making architectural decisions. By analyzing data, you can make informed design choices that align with the specific needs of your workload, leading to more effective and efficient solutions.

Make AWS Cloud architectural decisions static, one-time events: This principle highlights the significance of making well-thought-out architectural decisions upfront. Architectural decisions should not be treated as one-time events but rather as ongoing considerations throughout the lifecycle of your application. It emphasizes the need for careful planning and taking a proactive approach to ensure long-term success in the AWS Cloud.

Selected Answer: D
D. Use Amazon CloudFront with the EC2 instances configured as the source.

"Amazon CloudFront is a web service that gives businesses and web application developers an easy and cost effective way to distribute content with low latency and high data transfer speeds. Like other AWS services, Amazon CloudFront is a self-service, pay-per-use offering, requiring no long term commitments or minimum fees. With CloudFront, your files are delivered to end-users using a global network of edge locations."

https://aws.amazon.com/cloudfront/faqs/?nc=sn&loc=5&dn=2

Selected Answer: D
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudFront/latest/DeveloperGuide/Introduction.html

Selected Answer: D
CloudFront will seamlessly route clients' requests to the API in the Region with the lowest latency to the client's location.

questions.question_text:
A company wants its Amazon EC2 instances to provide a low-latency static website to global users.

What should the company do to meet this requirement?

choices.C: Use the EC2 instances in the same Availability Zone but in different AWS Regions.
choices.D: Use Amazon Cloud Front with the EC2 instances configured as the source.
choices.A: Use the EC2 instances in multiple edge locations.
choices.B: Use an Application Load Balancer with the EC2 instances configured as the target.

questions.question_text:
A company wants to optimize tong-term compute costs of AWS Lambda functions and Amazon EC2 instances.

Which AWS purchasing option should the company choose to meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Compute Savings Plans provide the most flexibility and help to reduce your costs by up to 66%. These plans automatically apply to EC2 instance usage regardless of instance family, size, AZ, Region, OS or tenancy, and also apply to Fargate or Lambda usage. For example, with Compute Savings Plans, you can change from C4 to M5 instances, shift a workload from EU (Ireland) to EU (London), or move a workload from EC2 to Fargate or Lambda at any time and automatically continue to pay the Savings Plans price.

Selected Answer: B
B. Compute Savings Plans

Selected Answer: B
https://aws.amazon.com/savingsplans/compute-pricing/

Selected Answer: B
AWS Lambda participates in Compute Savings Plans, a flexible pricing model that offers low prices on Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2), AWS Fargate, and Lambda usage, in exchange for a commitment to a consistent amount of usage (measured in $/hour) for a one- or three-year term. With Compute Savings Plans, you can save up to 17 percent on AWS Lambda. Savings apply to duration and Provisioned Concurrency. Learn more Â»

Compute Savings Plans:

Answer: B
Compute Savings Plans provide flexibility by offering savings on compute usage across multiple services, including EC2 instances, AWS Lambda, and Fargate.

Selected Answer: C
Reserved Instances provide significant cost savings compared to On-Demand instances by offering a discounted hourly rate. They require a one- or three-year commitment for a specific instance type, operating system, and region. By committing to Reserved Instances, the company can achieve substantial cost savings over time for their Lambda functions and EC2 instances.

Selected Answer: A
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/operational-excellence-pillar/operational-excellence.html

Selected Answer: A
A. Operational excellence

"Anticipate failure: Perform âpre-mortemâ exercises to identify potential sources of failure so that they can be removed or mitigated. Test your failure scenarios and validate your understanding of their impact. Test your response procedures to ensure they are effective and that teams are familiar with their process. Set up regular game days to test workload and team responses to simulated events."

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/operational-excellence-pillar/operational-excellence.html#:~:text=Anticipate%20failure%3A,to%20simulated%20events.

questions.question_text:
A company encourages its teams to test failure scenarios regularly and to validate their understanding of the impact of potential failures.

Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework does this philosophy represent?
